saving.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an amount of money that you have not spent, or an amount of something that you have not used
saving.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The new engines will lead to savings in fuel.
All small companies will need to make savings if they are to survive.
saving.translation[0].definitions[1].def: when you save money rather than spend it
saving.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the act of keeping money to use later rather than spending it
saving.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: We want to encourage saving and investment.
saving.translation[1].definitions[1].def: an amount of something that you have not used or spent, especially compared with a larger amount that you could have used or spent
saving.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: This amount represents a considerable saving over last year’s expenditure.
Recent pension-plan changes will make a saving of $400 million next year.
saving.translation[1].definitions[2].def: money that is kept in a bank to be used later or invested, rather than spent
saving.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Investors lost their life savings (=all the money they had saved during their life) when the bank collapsed.
saving.translation[1].definitions[3].def: when total income in the economy is more than the total amount spent on goods
